t/f.question: 1. With a virtual-circuit network layer, packet switches are involved in virtual circuit setup, and each packet switch it aware of the VCs passing through it.
2. With a datagram network layer, each packet carries the address of the destination host.
3. In a distance-vector routing algorithm, each node has a map of the entire network and determines the shortest path from itself to all other nodes in the network.
4. In the BGP routing algorithm, each AS advertises to its neighbors its estimates of the shortest distances from the AS to all possible destination ASs.
5. OSPF uses BGP for routing among areas.
6. Every autonomous system must use the same intra-autonomous system routing algorithm.

7. Suppose the computer in your office has been configured with an IP address, and you move (along with your computer) to an office down the hall. If after the move your computer is connected to the same IP network, then it is not necessary to reconfigure the IP address in your computer.
8. Single-homed hosts have one interface and routers typically have two or more interfaces.
9. A gateway router must run both an intra-AS routing algorithm and an inter-AS routing algorithm.
10. The network portion of an IP address is the same for all the hosts on the same IP network.
11. NAT is known as a 'plug-n-play' or 'zero-conf' protocol

mc.question: 12. Which of the following are properties of link-state algorithms.
mc.option1: A. after the kth iteration, the least cost paths are known to k nodes
mc.option2: B. It requires the source node to know the costs between every pair of adjacent nodes in the graph
mc.option3: C. It determines the shortest path from the source node to all other nodes.

mc.question: 13. In routing among AS's, which of the following issues are dominant

14. An application generates a 60 byte packet. This chunk is then sent to the transport layer and then the network layer. At this point, what percentage of the bytes in the datagram are the original application data?
15. The maximum amount of data that a _______ layer frame can carry is called Maximum Transmission Unit or MTU.
16.According to the classful IP addressing schema, which of the following IP address belongs to the class-B IP address range
17. The role of a routing table is to _______
mc.option1: A. transfer a packet from input link of a router to the appropriate outgoing link of a router
mc.option2: B. determine the end-to-end path that packet takes from source to destination
mc.option3: C. make sure all packets have arrived in correct sequence
mc.option4: D. none of the above options

mc.question: 18. The ICMP protocol
mc.option1: A. runs on top of UDP
mc.option2: B. runs on top of IP
mc.option3: C. runs on top of TCP

mc.question: 19. In a router, queuing can occur
20. Which of the following switching mediums allow more than one packets to be forwarded from an input port to their appropriate output port
